Having actually trained in high altitude simulators, I have strenuous doubts about this design.  While I have heard it looks "cool" and I admit it does, it does not appear to offer either pressurization nor thermal protection nor survivability needed for any type of capsule emergency for which these suits are designed.   It is not obvious compared to the pressure suits for launch used in the past.  Look at the pressure suits used by high altitude pilots used today.  They are heavy to insulate; they float for ditching and they are international orange for rescue.   How does this suit do any of that?

I wonder how flight suits actually perform. Has there been any incident where they were used? I know one of the salyut missions depressurized, and all the cosmonauts died, and this is the reason everyone wears flight suits.

For instance if the Columbia astronauts had time to get their suits on, they would probably still be dead, but if something happened in orbit or ascent, would a flight suit keep astronauts alive long enough to reenter?

How does the life support for the suits work, how long do they keep you alive on their own, do they plug into the capsule to provide indefinite life support? Or are they just to keep you from passing out during depressurisation, and you gradually overheat/asphixiyate after that?

The zipper seals are reminiscent of Nasa's first forays into mechanically pressurized elastic and kevlar suits, the design is form fitting and not cumbersome (though I'd be interested in seeing how tight it fits and the range of motion) and the asthetics are mwah!

On that last note, the first time I saw this I immediately fell in love with it because it looks almost exactly like many images and descriptions I've seen of the "skinsuit" from David Weber's Honorverse series. https://i.pinimg.com/originals/94/d0/08/94d00839d9af9d2f883f572672413489.jpg To me, this is another example of SpaceX making Sci-Fi reality and I could not be happier with that.

Well it maybe a IVA suit but Elon has said the ONLY thing missing from it rated as EVA suit is the radiation protection and extra O2. Meaning ~7-8 psi if using pure O2 or ~14-15 psi (1 atmosphere) if Oxygen Nitrogen mix. Most likely would use pure O2 for EVA as that allows lower pressure and thus easier to move.
